citation.article-title: Comamonas Davis and Park 1962 gen. nov., nom. rev. emend., and Comamonas terrigena Hugh 1962 sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Comamonas terrigena nom. rev., sp. nov.
Comamonas terrigena (ter.ri.ge'na. L.n. terra soil; L.v. gignere to bear; L.n. terrigena borne by the earth [soil], child of the earth)
The description of Comamonas terrigena is the same as that for the genus.

The following biochemical, physiological, and nutritional characteristics are present in the four strains of the species: growth at 37°C; motility; growth in the presence of 1.5% NaCl or 5 mg of gentian violet per liter; oxidase; catalase; nitrate reduction; esterase (C4); leucine arylamidase; phosphoamidase; growth on D-gluconate, acetate, butyrate, n-caproate, isobutyrate, isovalerate, propionate, n-valerate, adipate, azelate, fumarate (weak), glutarate, pimelate, sebacate, suberate, succinate, DL-glycerate, DL-3-hydroxybutyrate, DL-lactate, D-malate (weak), aconitate, citraconate, α-ketoglutarate (weak), levulinate, mesaconate (weak), pyruvate, D-α-alanine, L-α-alanine, β-alanine (weak), Laspartate, L-glutamate, L-isoleucine, L-leucine, L-norleucine, DL-norvaline, L-proline , L-valine, and L-threonine (weak).

The following characteristics are absent in the four strains: growth at 42°C; growth in the presence of 4.5% NaCl; anaerobic growth; formation of pigment; acid production in oxidative-fermentative, 10% lactose, and triple sugar irion media; fluorescence; growth on cetrimide; hydrolysis of Tween 80, gelatin, acetamide, and DNA; amylase; lysine or ornithine decarboxylase; arginine dihydrolase; nitrite reduction; urease; hydrolysis of esculin; indole production; production of H2S in triple sugar iron medium; lipase (C14); cystine or valine arylamidase; trypsin; chymotrypsin; α-D-galactosidase; β-D-galactosidase; β-D-glucuronidase; α-D-glucosidase; β-D-glucosidase; N-acetyl-β-D-gluco saminidase; α-D-mannosidase; α-L-fucosidase; growth on N-acetyl-glucosamine, amygdalin, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, esculin, D-fructose, D-fucose, L-fucose, D-galactose, gentiobiose, D-glucosamine, D-glucose, glycogen, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, lactose, D-lyxose, maltose, D-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl-α-D-glucoside, methyl-α-D-mannoside, methyl-β-D-xyloside, raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, salicin, L-sorbose, starch, sucrose, D-tagatose, trehalose, D-turanose, D-xylose, L-xylose, adonitol, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, dulcitol, meso-erythritol, meso-inositol, D-mannitol, sorbitol, meso-xylitol, caprylate, pelargonate, maleate, malonate, oxalate, glycolate, D-tartrate , L-tartrate, meso-tartrate, citrate, benzoate, o-hydroxybenzoate, m-hydroxybenzoate, p-hydroxybenzoate, D-mandelate, L-mandelate, phenylacetate, phthalate, isophthalate, terephthalate, L-arginine, Lcitrulline, L-cysteine, glycine, L-histidine, DL-kynurenine, L-lysine, L-methionine, L-ornithine, L-phenylalanine, Lserine, trigonelline, D-tryptophan, L-tryptophan, acetamide, 2-aminobenzoate, 3-aminobenzoate, 4-aminobenzoate, DL-2-aminobutyrate, DL-3-aminobutyrate, DL-4-aminobutyrate, DL-5-aminovalerate, amylamine, benzylamine, betaine, butylamine, creatine, diaminobutane, ethanolamine, ethylamine, histamine, sarcosine, spermine, tryptamine, and urea.

The following characteristics are present in only some strains (the strains giving positive reactions are indicated in parentheses): resistance to penicillin (10 μg/disk) (strain CCUG 12940); production of acid phosphatase (strains NCIB 8193T and NCIB 2582); and growth on glycerol (strain NCIB 8193T), caprate (strain CCUG 12940), L-malate (strain CCUG 12940), heptanoate (strains NCIB 8193T and CCUG 12940), itaconate (strains NCIB 8193T and CCUG 12940), and L-tyrosine (strains NCIB 8193T and CCUG 12940).

The following API 20NE profiles were obtained: 1000424 for strains NCIB 8193T, NCIB 2581, and NCIB 2582 (profile not listed in the API 20NE Analytical Profile Index [3]); and 1000474 for strain CCUG 12940 (P. testosteroni-Pseudomonas alcaligenes according to the Analytical Profile Index).
The characteristics of C. terrigena are in agreement with those reported by Hugh (33, 34) for strain ATCC 8461T, except for the urease reaction, which was negative in our experiments.
The flagellar morphology of strain ATCC 8461T has been described previously (33, 40).
A peritrichous variant (strain ATCC 17758; not included in this study) of strain ATCC 8461T has been described (40).
C. terrigena has been isolated from soil and human blood (other habitats are not excluded).
The G+C content of C. terrigena DNA is 64 to 66 mol%.
The type strain is strain NCIB 8193 (=LMG 1253 [=CCUG 153271=ATCC 8451=NCTC 1937=CIP 63.44=CCUG 2185 [=LMG 59291=Veron 31=Hugh 247).
This strain was isolated in 1921 from a filtrate of hay infusion (47).
The characteristics of the type strain are the same as those given above fQr the species.
The G+C content of the DNA is 64 mol% (our data).
Similar values have been reported previously (64.6 mol% [53] and 65 mol% [12]).
